item.title: Perinatal Period
item.description: During or around birth

item.title: Developmental Research
item.description: Types of developmental research designs Cross-sectional design - many individuals at single point in time Longitudinal design - examine the same individuals over a period of time

item.title: Normative vs Idiographic
item.description: In Developmental Psychology, patterns of change can be - Normative Idiographic focuses on what we share in common focuses on individual differences “normal” or typical changes different for everyone milestones for babies, for example individual variations outside of the range of normative dev and why

item.title: Midlife Crisis
item.description: occurs usually around 40 - 60 Identity, role, self-doubt regarding : professional life achievements family psychological aspects > physical aspects in terms of effect

item.title: Kagan's Behavioural Inhibition
item.description: Classifying [[Temperament]] in infants based on differences between shy, subdued, timid child and a sociable, extraverted bold child Inhibited Children -
Oestrogen - Ovulation thinning of mucus thickening of lining Progesterone - Menstrual Cycle thickening of mucus thinning of lining FSH - pituitary gland -

item.title: Assessing of newborns
item.description: APGAR Scale done at one and five minutes after A - Appearance P - Pulse G - Reflexes A - Activity R - Respiration

item.title: Birth Complications
item.description: Low birth weight - below 5.5 pounds - very low weight - extremely low weight - below 2.5 preterm infants small for date (aka small for gestational age) below normal weight in relation to length of pregnancy can be preterm or full term

item.title: Stages of birth
item.description: The Birth Process occurs in three stages First Stage Uterine contractions cause the woman’s cervix to stretch and open DILATE the cervix to an opening of ~10cm so baby can move from uterus to birth canal

item.title: Types of Birth
item.description: Natural aims to decrease pain by decreasing fear through education about childbirth and breathing techniques are used 1. Natural Vaginal 2.

item.title: Theories of Human Development
item.description: flowchart LR A(Theories of Human Development) subgraph psychoanalytic B(Psychosocial Theory by Erik Erikson) C(Psychosexual by Freud) end subgraph cognitive E(Piaget's Cognitive Dev) F(Vygotsky's Social Cognitive) G(Information Processing Theory) end subgraph etho S(Lorenz's Ethological) V(Bowlby's Attachment) R(Ainsworth's Attachment) end A---etho A---Q(Urie's Ecological) A---psychoanalytic A---cognitive see also: [[Introduction to Life Span Development#Perspectives / Key issues in Lifespan Development|Key issues in Lifespan Development]]

item.title: Couvade Syndrome
item.description: etymology - the word couvade comes from the Breton word couver, which means to brood, hatch, or incubate Couvade syndrome is also called sympathetic pregnancy.

item.title: Emerging Adulthood
item.description: Emerging adulthood transition from adolescence to adulthood 18 - 25 characterized by experimentation and exploration Criteria for adulthood economic independence taking responsibility for consequences of one’s actions Physical Development Peak physical health - 19 to 26 slowdown in physical performance emerging adults have 2x mortality rate of adolescents Sexual Development Most individuals are sexually active and become married engage in sexual intercourse more than young adults casual sex in more common than in young adulthood

item.title: Important Questions - Psychology
item.description: Define neonate and outline the patterns of development What are the three basic [[Temperament]]al styles Discuss the importance of friendship and peer relationships during adolescence Define language and biological influence on [[Language Development]] DIscuss types of reflexes in infants Stages of language development Describe the physical changes that occur during puberty Marcias Identity Statuses Explain components of language 9M

item.title: Infancy, Childhood, and Adolescence
item.description: Neonate -> Infant between 0 and 28 days/4 weeks learns feeding patterns aka newborn Physical Development Gross Motor Fine Motor Patterns of growth Cephalocaudal Pattern head to toe Proximodistal growth starts in the center and moves to extremities After birth - lose 5-7% of body weight before they adjust to feeding

item.title: Language Development
item.description: something Rules of Language Phonology Morphology Syntax Semantics Pragmatic Child Directed Speech Language Acquisition Device (LAD) - [[Noam Chomsky]] Stages of Language Development Cooing Babbling One Word Speech Telegraphic Speech Whole sentence [[Broca’s Area]] [[Wernicke’s Area]]

item.title: Life Span Development introduction
item.description: Life Span Development dev from conception to death lifelong progressive orderly what is development? Development is the pattern of progressive, orderly and predictable changes that begin at conception and continue throughout life.

item.title: Marcia's Identity Statuses
item.description: Identity Diffusion Identity Foreclosure Identity Moratorium Identity Achievement based on [[Erik Erikson’s Psychosocial Stages]]

item.title: Moral Development Theory
item.description: by Lawrence Kohlberg [[Heinz Dilemma]] social and cultural norms LEARNT 3 levels - Preconventional (5-9) Stage 1. Obedience and Punishment obey rules only to avoid punishment Stage 2.

item.title: Self Concept Development
item.description: Self Concept Definition Attributes, characteristics, what makes us us. physically, emotionally, socially, spiritually overall idea we have about who we are how we perceive, think, and value ourselves
